description.narrative: Flooding part of wider effected area of South Asia - Bangladesh Nepal India and Pakistan. Since the second week of August heavy rainfall in the main river basins and upstream catchments of India coupled with downpours across northern regions of Bangladesh have led to severe flooding which has prompted the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies to launch a 2.2 million CHF (approx. 1.45 million) international appeal to help the Bangladesh Red Crescent Society provide humanitarian assistance to 97 000 people. The floods have affected over 3 million people across 20 districts in low-lying areas in the east west and central areas of the country. Over 340 000 people were forced from their homes and 34 000 houses were completely destroyed. The country s inter-agency needs assessment report describes the situation as the most severe floods the country has faced since the mega-flood of 2007 . Bangladesh Red Crescent Society has been on the ground responding since the floods began. Hundreds of staff and volunteers have reached thousands of families providing them with food personal hygiene items shelter materials safe drinking water and medical services.
